010package imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.guibas;
011
012import java.util.ArrayList;
013import java.util.Collection;
014import java.util.Collections;
015import java.util.LinkedList;
016import java.util.List;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.DelaunayTriangulation;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.Triangle;
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.Utils;
022
023/**
024 * This is an implementation of the triangulation algorithm described in
025 * <blockquote>
026 * L. J. Guibas, D. E. Knuth, and M. Sharir" "Randomized incremental construction of 
027 * Delaunay and Voronoi diagrams", Algorithmica, 7, pp. 381--413 (1992).
028 * </blockquote>
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 *
032 */
033public class TriangulationGuibas implements DelaunayTriangulation {
034
035        private final List<Pnt2d> points;
036        private final List<Triangle2D> triangles;
037        private final Triangle2D outerTriangle;
038
039        /**
040         * Constructor. 
041         * @param points the point set to be triangulated
042         * @param shuffle set {@code true} to randomly shuffle the input points
043         */
044        public TriangulationGuibas(Collection<? extends Pnt2d> points, boolean shuffle) {
045                if (points == null || points.size() < 3) {
046                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Point set must contain at least 3 points.");
047                }
048                this.points = new ArrayList<Pnt2d>(points);
049                if (shuffle) {
050                        Collections.shuffle(this.points);
051                }
052                this.outerTriangle = new Triangle2D(Utils.makeOuterTriangle(points));
053                this.triangles = new ArrayList<>();
054                triangulate();
055        }
056        
057        /**
058         * Constructor. 
059         * Supplied points are inserted without shuffling, i.e.,
060         * in their original order.
061         * 
062         * @param points the point set to be triangulated
063         */
064        public TriangulationGuibas(Collection<? extends Pnt2d> points) {
065                this(points, false);
066        }
067        
068        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
069        
070        @Override
071        public int size() {
072                return triangles.size();
073        }
074        
075        @Override
076        public List<Triangle> getTriangles() {
077                return Collections.unmodifiableList(triangles);
078        }
079        
080        @Override
081        public List<Pnt2d> getPoints() {
082                return points;
083        }
084        
085        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
086
087        private void triangulate() {
088                triangles.add(outerTriangle);
089                
090                for (Pnt2d pnt : points) {
091                        Triangle2D triangle = this.findContainingTriangle(pnt);
092
093                        if (triangle == null) { // pnt is outside of any triangle
094                                /* If no containing triangle exists, then the vertex is not inside a triangle
095                                 * (this can also happen due to numerical errors) and lies on an edge. In order
096                                 * to find this edge we search all edges of the triangle soup and select the one
097                                 * which is nearest to the point we try to add. This edge is removed and four
098                                 * new edges are added.
099                                 */
100                                Edge2D edge = this.findNearestEdge(pnt);
101
102                                Triangle2D tr1 = this.findOneTriangleSharing(edge);
103                                Triangle2D tr2 = this.findNeighbour(tr1, edge);
104
105                                Pnt2d noneEdgeVertex1 = tr1.getOppositeVertex(edge);
106                                Pnt2d noneEdgeVertex2 = tr2.getOppositeVertex(edge);
107
108                                triangles.remove(tr1);
109                                triangles.remove(tr2);
110
111                                Triangle2D triangle1 = new Triangle2D(edge.a, noneEdgeVertex1, pnt);
112                                Triangle2D triangle2 = new Triangle2D(edge.b, noneEdgeVertex1, pnt);
113                                Triangle2D triangle3 = new Triangle2D(edge.a, noneEdgeVertex2, pnt);
114                                Triangle2D triangle4 = new Triangle2D(edge.b, noneEdgeVertex2, pnt);
115
116                                triangles.add(triangle1);
117                                triangles.add(triangle2);
118                                triangles.add(triangle3);
119                                triangles.add(triangle4);
120
121
122                                legalizeEdge(triangle1, new Edge2D(edge.a, noneEdgeVertex1), pnt);
123                                legalizeEdge(triangle2, new Edge2D(edge.b, noneEdgeVertex1), pnt);
124                                legalizeEdge(triangle3, new Edge2D(edge.a, noneEdgeVertex2), pnt);
125                                legalizeEdge(triangle4, new Edge2D(edge.b, noneEdgeVertex2), pnt);
126                        } 
127                        else { // pnt is inside the triangle <a,b,c>.
128                                Pnt2d a = triangle.a;
129                                Pnt2d b = triangle.b;
130                                Pnt2d c = triangle.c;
131
132                                triangles.remove(triangle);
133
134                                Triangle2D triangle1 = new Triangle2D(a, b, pnt);
135                                Triangle2D triangle2 = new Triangle2D(b, c, pnt);
136                                Triangle2D triangle3 = new Triangle2D(c, a, pnt);
137
138                                triangles.add(triangle1);
139                                triangles.add(triangle2);
140                                triangles.add(triangle3);
141
142                                legalizeEdge(triangle1, new Edge2D(a, b), pnt);
143                                legalizeEdge(triangle2, new Edge2D(b, c), pnt);
144                                legalizeEdge(triangle3, new Edge2D(c, a), pnt);
145                        }
146                }
147
148                // Remove all triangles containing any vertex of the super triangle:
149                this.removeTrianglesUsing(outerTriangle.a);
150                this.removeTrianglesUsing(outerTriangle.b);
151                this.removeTrianglesUsing(outerTriangle.c);
152        }
153
154        /**
155         * This method legalizes edges by recursively flipping all illegal edges.
156         * 
157         * @param triangle  the triangle
158         * @param edge      the edge to be legalized
159         * @param newVertex the new vertex
160         */
161        private void legalizeEdge(Triangle2D triangle, Edge2D edge, Pnt2d newVertex) {
162                Triangle2D neighbourTriangle = this.findNeighbour(triangle, edge);
163                // If the triangle has a neighbor, then legalize the edge
164                if (neighbourTriangle != null) {
165                        if (neighbourTriangle.isPointInCircumCircle(newVertex)) {
166                                triangles.remove(triangle);
167                                triangles.remove(neighbourTriangle);
168
169                                Pnt2d noneEdgeVertex = neighbourTriangle.getOppositeVertex(edge);
170
171                                Triangle2D triangle1 = new Triangle2D(noneEdgeVertex, edge.a, newVertex);
172                                Triangle2D triangle2 = new Triangle2D(noneEdgeVertex, edge.b, newVertex);
173
174                                triangles.add(triangle1);
175                                triangles.add(triangle2);
176
177                                legalizeEdge(triangle1, new Edge2D(noneEdgeVertex, edge.a), newVertex);
178                                legalizeEdge(triangle2, new Edge2D(noneEdgeVertex, edge.b), newVertex);
179                        }
180                }
181        }
182        
183        // triangle-related methods ---------------------------
184
185        /**
186         * Returns the triangle that contains the specified point or null if no
187         * such triangle exists.
188         * @param point the query point
189         * @return the containing triangle or {@code null} if none was found
190         */
191        public Triangle2D findContainingTriangle(Pnt2d point) {
192                for (Triangle2D triangle : triangles) {
193                        if (triangle.containsPoint(point)) {
194                                return triangle;
195                        }
196                }
197                return null;
198        }
199
200        /**
201         * Returns the neighboring triangle of the specified triangle sharing the same edge
202         * as specified. If no neighbor sharing the same edge exists {@code null} is returned.
203         * NOTE: Searching over ALL triangles seems to be unnecessarily expensive!
204         * 
205         * @param tri1 the triangle
206         * @param edge the edge
207         * @return the triangle's neighboring triangle sharing the same edge or {@code null} if no
208         *         such triangle exists
209         */
210        public Triangle2D findNeighbour(Triangle2D tri1, Edge2D edge) {
211                for (Triangle2D tri2 : triangles) {
212                        if (tri2.containsEdge(edge) && tri2 != tri1) {
213                                return tri2;
214                        }
215                }
216                return null;
217        }
218
219        /**
220         * Returns one of the possible triangles sharing the specified edge. Based on
221         * the ordering of the triangles in this triangle soup the returned triangle may
222         * differ. To find the other triangle that shares this edge use the
223         * {@code findNeighbour(Triangle2D triangle, Edge2D edge)} method.
224         * @param edge the edge
225         * @return the triangle that shares the specified edge or {@code null} if none exists
226         */
227        public Triangle2D findOneTriangleSharing(Edge2D edge) {
228                for (Triangle2D triangle : triangles) {
229                        if (triangle.containsEdge(edge)) {
230                                return triangle;
231                        }
232                }
233                return null;
234        }
235        
236        /**
237         * Returns the triangle edge nearest to the specified point.
238         * 
239         * @param point the query point
240         * @return the triangle edge nearest to the specified point
241         */
242        public Edge2D findNearestEdge(Pnt2d point) {
243                Edge2D minEdge = null;
244                double minDist = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
245                for (Triangle2D tri : triangles) {
246                        Edge2D.Distance ed = tri.findMinEdgeDistance(point);
247                        double dist = ed.getDistance();
248                        if (dist < minDist) {
249                                minDist = dist;
250                                minEdge = ed.getEdge();
251                        }
252                }
253                return minEdge;
254        }
255
256        /**
257         * Removes all triangles that contain the specified corner point.
258         * @param point the corner point
259         */
260        public void removeTrianglesUsing(Pnt2d point) {
261                List<Triangle2D> trianglesToBeRemoved = new LinkedList<>();
262                for (Triangle2D triangle : triangles) {
263                        if (triangle.hasVertex(point)) {
264                                trianglesToBeRemoved.add(triangle);
265                        }
266                }
267                triangles.removeAll(trianglesToBeRemoved);
268        }
269        
270        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
271

289//      }
290
291
292}
